data.title: H-Diplo
data.text:
The following jobs were posted to the H-Net Job Guide from 5 August to 12 August. These job postings are included here based on the categories selected by the network editors for H-Diplo. See the H-Net job guide web site at https://www.h-net.org/jobs/ for more information. To contact the Job Guide, write to jobguide@mail.h-net.org or call +1-517-432-5134 between 9 AM and 5 PM US Eastern time.

Call for Applications:

“Writing the History of U.S. Foreign Relations in an Age of Crisis”

2025 SHAFR Summer Institute, June 21-25, 2025, Yale University, New Haven, Connecticut

Faculty Directors: Alvita Akiboh and Michael Brenes (Yale University)

The largest land war in Europe since World War II, looming conflict with China, war in Gaza, and instability in states such as Haiti, Syria, and Afghanistan have fundamentally reshaped global affairs. These conflicts exist alongside unprecedented rates of economic and racial inequality, the escalating havoc wrought by climate change, and the reemergence

The Scuola Superiore Meridionale, Naples (Italy), invites applications for four 1-year (renewable for up to 3 years) postdoc fellowships in Global History and Governance.

The program in Global History and Governance:

Dear H-Diplo readers,

In keeping with its standard practice, H-Diplo will implement a publishing moratorium from 05 August until 03 September. We anticipate a lively 2024/25 series of publications, including our roundtable, book, and article reviews; our “Learning the Scholar’s Craft” essays; and several new and continuing essay series and policy forums.

This may be an ideal time to catch up on past H-Diplo and H-Diplo/RJISSF publications, which are available on the webpage at https://networks.h-net.org/h-diplo and https://issforum.org/

H-Diplo will continue to function during this period, with

The following jobs were posted to the H-Net Job Guide from 29 July to 5 August. These job postings are included here based on the categories selected by the network editors for H-Diplo. See the H-Net job guide web site at https://www.h-net.org/jobs/ for more information. To contact the Job Guide, write to jobguide@mail.h-net.org or call +1-517-432-5134 between 9 AM and 5 PM US Eastern time.

Stephenson, Marcia. Llamas Beyond the Andes: Untold Histories of Camelids in the Modern World. Austin: University of Texas Press, 2023. viii + 380 pp. $45.00 (cloth), ISBN 9781477328408.

Reviewed by Hanne Cottyn (Ghent University)

Published on H-Diplo (August, 2024)

Commissioned by Seth Offenbach (Bronx Community College, The City University of New York)

Shrout, Anelise Hanson. Aiding Ireland: The Great Famine and the Rise of Transnational Philanthropy. New York: New York University Press, 2024. 272 pp. $35.00 (cloth), ISBN 9781479824595.

Reviewed by Elizabeth Stack (American Irish Historical Society)

Published on H-Diplo (July, 2024)

Commissioned by Seth Offenbach (Bronx Community College, The City University of New York)
